intro: Ornithogalum platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually white or pale blue and are arranged in clusters. Ornithogalum platyphyllum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
